TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Samuel M Williams, 04-02-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Saltillo, April 2, 1831. Interest in passage of a general law for the government of territories. Slavery. Hold aloof from conflict between Madero and Bradburn. " In these matters say little or nothing, and nothing definite." Law excluding foreigners from retail trade.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: A law to exclude foreigners from engaging in retail trade. It appears not to have passed at this session, but was published Apr. 9, 1832. See Gammel, Laws of Texas, I, 295, and Austin to Williams, Apr. 18, 1831.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Saltillo, April 2, 1831. Interest in passage of a general law for the government of territories. Slavery. Hold aloof from conflict between Madero and Bradburn. " In these matters say little or nothing, and nothing definite." Law excluding foreigners from retail trade. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*L[eona]. Viacario */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="04-02-1831">April 2. 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir.*/p*
*p*I have nothing of much interest to communicate. I refer you and *person_mentioned*Luke */person_mentioned*to my letters to *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Williamson*/person_mentioned*. I kept no copy of either of them, and may need the one to *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*after my return, for which reason I wish you would request him not to let it be destroyed.*/p*
*p*There is nothing new from *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*of a political nature—*person_mentioned*Mexia*/person_mentioned* has arrived there from *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* and will be here in all this month, on the subject of the *person_mentioned*land company*/person_mentioned* formed in *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Genl Teran*/person_mentioned* writes on *date_mentioned n="03-21-1831">21 ult.*/date_mentioned* that he agrees with me in opinion that *person_mentioned*Bradburn*/person_mentioned* has misconstrued the law as to tonnage duty—that he will examine into it and give an order to have all but the first refunded to*person_mentioned* S Rhoads [Fisher]*/person_mentioned* and I have no doubt it will be done- he says that he probably will be here this *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1831">month */date_mentioned*on his way to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*where he goes to visit his *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I wish you to take the copy of the oficio that *person_mentioned*Jorge [Fisher] */person_mentioned*wrote about the *person_mentioned*free negroes*/person_mentioned*, and burn it, that is I mean the copy that was signed by me, in case I ever signed any which I do this recollect to have done, and carefully keep the copy and letter on that subject which is in his hand writing don't neglect to do this before you forget it, and send him no papers of any sort—you did very right in not sending those he wrote for.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Padre Muldoon */person_mentioned*was still in *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*on the *date_mentioned n="03-21-1831">21 March*/date_mentioned*, but anxious to get on. I presume he will wait untill the *person_mentioned*Genl */person_mentioned*decides whether he goes to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*or to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*This is holy week, of course nothing done in the Legislature, tho we have had any quantity of processions etc—the one last night which began at 8 and ended at 11—was beautifull—about 800 *person_mentioned*females */person_mentioned*walked in two lines each with a wax candle—the night was calm and dark—the lights made a fine display in these *location_mentioned*streets*/location_mentioned*, some of which assend near 200 feet in half a mile.*/p*
*p*We are at a law to prevent *person_mentioned*foreigners */person_mentioned*from retailing—at first I thought it would pass—I now think it will not. I shall oppose it in its present shape.*/p*
*p*I am promised an officio to *person_mentioned*Arciniega */person_mentioned*by next mail in answer to the *person_mentioned*consulta */person_mentioned*about the restriction—he may go on and put them all in possession, without any fears. I shall have no difficulty of any sort with *person_mentioned*Boss [Teran?]*/person_mentioned*. Close all the *date_mentioned n="06-04-1831">4 of June*/date_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*as fast as possible. I ought to go to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*with *person_mentioned*Teran */person_mentioned*if he goes, but how can I, without money, and required at home. I am undecided as yet as to this point, and rather think that if I had 500 dollars I would go on. Much depends on the organic law for the *location_mentioned*territories*/location_mentioned*. I have written many sheets on this subject and on slavery to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*but there is nothing like being personally present. Let me know by return of mail (if time will permit) what *person_mentioned*Luke */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Johnson*/person_mentioned* and others think of my views about a *location_mentioned*territory */location_mentioned*and the manner of managing the *person_mentioned*slave */person_mentioned*question—don't fail in this, there will be time for it [to] get here by*date_mentioned n="05-01-1831"> 1 of May*/date_mentioned*. As to the *location_mentioned*Trinity */location_mentioned*business *person_mentioned*Madero */person_mentioned*has the right side of the question—of that there is no doubt—and in the end he will come out, if he is prudent. I am compelled to touch that matter cautiously for the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*has much at stake—too much to be embarked in the cause of another. It is a hard and unpleasant situation to be placed in. Some use may be made of the big colonizing business of *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned*, but that must also be touched prudently. In these matters say little or nothing, and nothing deffinite, as many smooth words without meaning as you please. By *person_mentioned*Rodrigues */person_mentioned*I sent forty titles, on which I have paid forty dollars cash which you must collect. Send out the *person_mentioned*Gonzales */person_mentioned*titles without delay get *person_mentioned*Pettus */person_mentioned*to attend to it*/p*.
*p*Tell *person_mentioned*Arciniega */person_mentioned*that I have recd his letter of *date_mentioned n="03-08-1831">8 March*/date_mentioned* and will attend to all his requests. I fear that *person_mentioned*Hunter*/person_mentioned*s application is hopeless, on the subject of augmentations this Govt, will not yield. *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*is in a hubbub about its *location_mentioned*port*/location_mentioned*. I shall try another iniciative on *date_mentioned n="04-05-1831">Tuesday */date_mentioned*(*date_mentioned n="04-04-1831">Monday */date_mentioned*is post day) for *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Matagorda*/location_mentioned*. I have written direct to the *person_mentioned*Vice President*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*minister */person_mentioned*as to *location_mentioned*Galveston */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Matagorda */location_mentioned*some time ago, also to others in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*—Poca importa—they cannot build a wall across them all, as I told the good folks here which they took very ill, for they say the law ought to be a wall—I answered so it is, but the law of nature has a just right to break down all walls that are violent and notorious public nuisances.*/p*
*p*The act of the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*, which you sent me would have been very important if anything could have been done with the *person_mentioned*judiciary*/person_mentioned*, but it is impossible. Shew *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Williamson */person_mentioned*the article of the constitution about Jueces Arbitros, and remind *person_mentioned*Luke */person_mentioned*of my recommendation to him on that subject.*/p*
*p*All harmony is at an end in the *person_mentioned*legislature*/person_mentioned*, the Menudeo [retail] law has split us into three or four odd sort of lumps.*/p*
*p*Remember me to *person_mentioned*Sarah */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Eliza */person_mentioned*and my *person_mentioned*nephew Austin*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Mr Hunter.*/person_mentioned* I recd *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned*s letter and am much pleased with it, would have written by this mail but have not time—will try and bring him the poney and rigging he writes me for.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Govr */person_mentioned*has issued an order as I am told, to the *person_mentioned*Chief of Department*/person_mentioned* to report what *location_mentioned*colonies */location_mentioned*are commenced and how many *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*are recd in each. Be very particular as to this, and make out a corrected list, for the one on the old book is very incorrect- one fourth of them have left the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and ought not to be counted. The certificates ought to be numbered differently, for otherwise mistaken ideas will arise—by examining the Genl law of *date_mentioned n="04-14-1828">14 April 1828*/date_mentioned* you will see the importance of keeping a regular and correct list of the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*and it will be still more important if the Menudeo law passes.*/p*
*p*This paragraph to yourself only*/p*
*p*I expect *person_mentioned*Henry Austin*/person_mentioned* is in the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*by this time—-tell him to select his *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*without delay—he had the promise of*location_mentioned* tracts in the 10 League East of Brazos*/location_mentioned* and must have the preference, but the best way is to give out the idea that all that *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*is hung up untill I return. I also want a good tract for*person_mentioned* Mrs Holly, widow*/person_mentioned* of the late*person_mentioned* Doctor Holly,*/person_mentioned* who will remove to the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="Fall-1831">next fall*/date_mentioned* certain, and be the most valuable acquisition we have ever yet received, in the *person_mentioned*female */person_mentioned*line, or probably will receive. I shall get home the *date_mentioned n="04-30-1831">last of this month*/date_mentioned*. I am glad to hear that *person_mentioned*Bowie */person_mentioned*is married.*/p*
*p*P. S. Since writing the above I have had a long conversation with the *person_mentioned*Govr */person_mentioned*relative to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. [He] is a very just man, and will not consent to an unjust act, if he knows it. I am fully satisfied that the rights of the *person_mentioned*people east of my *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* will be fully respected in the end provided they do not attempt in any way to seek redress by force or violence—that will totally ruin them, and they had better submit to temporary evils than bring greater ones on themselves. I am much better pleased with the *person_mentioned*Govr */person_mentioned*than I ever expected to be. During the session various causes and considerations prevented me from being as intimate with him as I have been since—also the statements of others misled me as to a part of his character.*/p*
I hope my ideas as to a *location_mentioned*territory */location_mentioned*are not misunderstood. I think I stated distinctly in my letter of *date_mentioned n="03-31-1831">31 March*/date_mentioned*, that the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* ought not to move that question at present. I wish the Genl govt, to move it, we shall then have the advantage of making terms— that is we will agree if it suits us, and if not refuse, just as it may be expedient. I have more confidence in the present administration than I had—my faith in*person_mentioned* Boss [Teran?]*/person_mentioned* is unimpaired and all will be right in the end. If the official publication is made in the *location_mentioned*U. S. papers*/location_mentioned* stating that my *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*is not included in the 11 Article of the law of*date_mentioned n="04-06-1830"> 6 April*/date_mentioned*, have it published in the *location_mentioned*Mexican [papers.] */location_mentioned* *p*If no notice has been taken of the retail law, let it pass off in silence.*/p*
*p*Take care that the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*. do not entangle themselves by raising arbitri[os] not authorized by law, as I see they are about to do— the resolutions adopted as published in the paper of*date_mentioned n="04-14-1831"> 14 April*/date_mentioned* are illegal—the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*. can collect half the Taxes authorized by the 8 chapter of the ordinance as you will see by the law that was passed the last day of the session but you cannot tax anything not mentioned in that chapter. Be very cautious on this point. I proposed to give the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*. power to raise 8000 dolls, and assess the Tax as they might deem proper—it was objected to on the ground that no such discretionary power can be given, and I was compelled to accept of the law as it is or fail in toto */p* *p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Shew this letter to *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*or such parts as you please.*/p*
*/div1*
